title: Charge all of your Apple devices with $50 off this 24,000mAh Anker power bank
content:
Macworld

One of the things that stress me out most when out and about is the failing battery on my phone – yes, I know I should get a new one. Still, getting an Anker 24,000mAh power bank for $104 is a more versatile solution to my problem, especially as the gadget used to cost $150 at Amazon, making the discount a great catch.

We know that $104 isn’t the price you’ll see when visiting the product page, but you should make sure to tap the “Apply coupon” button right below the price to get that extra $6 off.

That being said, let’s dive into why this powerhouse is a great deal right now, whether you need to charge your phone or your laptop on the go. With a massive 24,000mAh battery capacity, you can fully charge your phone at least four times or your laptop about twice. At the very least, you’ll keep it going for quite a few hours past your estimates. This Anker model can charge up to three devices at once via the USB-A port and two USB-C ports.

It won’t take too long to charge up either because this Anker gadget provides a 140W charge to rapidly power up devices, as well as to recharge itself. You can check out information about the status of a charge through the tiny smart display available on the power bank. Besides output and input power, you’ll get an estimation of how long it will take for the power bank to reach 100 perfection.

Don’t miss out on getting your hands on this amazing 24,000mAh Anker power bank for $104 at Amazon.
